page.title: 17Three Pubs near Passfield.
page.content: The image of the village pub has changed now many serve good value food, lunches, and beverages. It is here where all types in the community may mix, and more now do so with the advent of lunch with no obligation to buy alcoholic drinks. The Royal Oak, Passfield is popular with young people. Darts, video games, bar snacks, and live music by visiting Bands are popular attractions. The Passfield Oak, Passfield,a lively 'free house',suits an older clientele. It provides varied bar food lunchtime and evening,and has a small resturant. The Robin Hood, Standford, was built in 1904. A 'free house', recently renovated by its Canadian owner, it serves good food, Mexican dishes, likes its weekend visitors to wear a coat and tie, and has a delightful situation for tables outside.
